person:biography.personal-details:content: I am an archaeologist (PhD) with a particular interest in wetlands. My main research projects have concerned wetland excavations in peatland environments, prehistoric fishing, and archaeological prospection. I am especially interested in hunter-fisher-gatherers and their subsistence strategies in Fennoscandia during the early and mid-Holocene. In 2017-18, I led a university project 'Lost Inland Landscapes' focusing on submerged and paludified Mesolithic sites at lakes Saimaa and Kuolimo, SE Finland. Currently, I am interested in the preservation of organic archaeological materials in drained peatlands and work within a new project concerning a prehistoric lakeside site Järvensuo in Humppila, SW Finland (c. 3500–500 BCE). This lake settlement is situated in a dynamic wetland landscape and I will be conducting archaeological and sedimentological fieldwork within this site in 2020-21.
